intro: Memecylon palawanense, commonly known as the Palawan memecylon, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by small, round berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
